title: Business & Finance
text:
Bankman-Fried's multimillion-dollar Washington charm offensive revolved around the CFTC and senators with whom the FTX founder found common cause in a bid for light-touch regulation of digital assets.

---

"Strange World" became the second consecutive Disney animated film to bomb at the box office, collecting only $18.6 million since opening Wednesday.

---

Black Friday store traffic rose from 2021 levels, but some shoppers spent cautiously as inflation weighs on pocketbooks.

---

Some investors expect lackluster earnings to send stocks lower this week as the market awaits results from Salesforce, Dollar General and other companies.

---

Potash mines near oil and natural-gas reserves are holding back Exxon's development of a key asset in the Permian Basin.

---

Six casino operators in Macau won provisional licenses to continue operating in the Chinese gambling hub for the next 10 years.

---

Ticketmaster's recent Taylor Swift tour fiasco prompted renewed calls to investigate the 12-year-old merger of the company and promoter Live Nation.
